reviews.text: We stayed at this lovely resort for three nights. We had a town home villa that is very clean and nicely decorated with an awesome kitchen. Great amenities both at Lakeshore and the J.W. Marriott next door. The pool was so very relaxing and clean. The resort staff is very friendly and helpful. We have been Marriott owners for several years and stayed at many of the resorts in Orlando. Lakeshore Reserve is a more low key property on beautiful and peaceful grounds. There is also a concierge on site if you need assistance with planning activities, etc. We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Relaxing Break in the heart of Orlando

reviews.text: The property is beautiful and the 2 bedroom suite was immaculate. The pool was one of the best assets for this property. The lazy river and the slide were so much fun for the kids and us. We spent most of our time in the pool. The resort is very well kept and not far from local attractions. Overall a great stay!
reviews.title: Awesome Vacation!

reviews.text: My family and I just returned from our second stay at this property. The property was immaculately kept and the villas were very clean and comfortable. The pool was wonderful (80 degrees) and there were always plenty of chairs.
reviews.title: Second Stay...Still Wonderful

reviews.text: I cannot say enough about how wonderful the staff was! The activities leaders were great with kids and adults! Walter, at check-in, was great and very responsive.
reviews.title: Great First Impression

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love that you have access to the two other properties when staying at LR. The lazy river and pool at the JW are wonderful and the spa at the Ritz was great!
reviews.title: Great Week, Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint with this resort is that they do not enforce the non smoking policy. I keep returning because the hotel is so nice and so is the pool. I love the close proximity to the JW Marriott and the Ritz Carlton. If you are looking for a hotel that is away from the disney chaos this would be a nice alternative.
reviews.title: Great marriott property

reviews.text: Our family owns several Marriott and R-C timeshares. By far and away our experience at Lakeshore Reserve was the best of the many properties in Orlando and elsewhere we've visited. The surroundings, pool and landscaping really need no comment - they speak for themselves. They're extremely well kept, lush and relaxing. We stayed in a 3B/3B right next to the pool, which at many resorts I would consider problematic due to noise and traffic. Not so at LR! The complex is small enough and the pools spacious enough that the chaos and noise pollution you find even at other higher-end Marriott properties is simply not an issue.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looking over the reviews, I'm simply baffled by comments about rude staff. Of all things that LR has to offer, perhaps the staff ranks #1. The concierge reached out months in advance to talk about our room preferences and any activities we wanted to do. And, of course, the hallmark of good concierge, they listened to what we wanted to do and made additional suggestions suited to our preferences - increasing our enjoyment and their profit - just as it should be. The golf cart service that connects LR to the Ritz and JW was instantaneous, and frankly I had a lovely time talking with the staff en route - a lot of insider tips and suggestions for local attractions. The walk between the three hotels in the complex is short, lakeside and an enjoyable leisure activity in and of itself. The rooms are sparklingly clean and well appointed, though I found the kitchen/dining room in the 3B/3B to be a bit narrow and tight.
reviews.title: Words can't do it justice. Perfection.

reviews.text: Some folks come to Orlando for Disney, Sea World and other high-voltage, "family activities." Frankly, I think it's a waste to stay at LR if you fall into that camp. Stay here if you intend to spend some meaningful portion of your time lazying about the pool, golfing and swimming. Take advantage of the reciprocity at R-C and JW. The spa at R-C is spectacular and mothers simply must hand off their kids for a few hours and go relax by the adults-only spa pool at R-C. I do wish there were more dining and drinking options within LR, but again R-C and JW have restaurants that range from casual to formal, set menu fair.
reviews.title: Great, relaxing property with all of the comforts of home

reviews.text: Families with poorly behaved children might be more comfortable at a larger resort, but we made friends with many families with young children, provided they're reasonably well-behaved children are certainly welcome by staff and guests alike.
reviews.title: Very Relaxing at an upscale timeshare

reviews.text: New, tasteful, well maintained, friendly. Great Mediterranean styled resort with only 80 or so units. There are studio, one and two bedroom villas as well as townhouses. The interiors have granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, upscale furnishings. We had a two bedroom villa which was actually a large one bedroom villa coupled with a smaller one bedroom villa. We had two living rooms, kitchens and patios. So large and plenty of room for everyone. The walk in shower was oversized and featured a rainshower head.
reviews.title: Best vacation villas in Orlando

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is a lazy river style. Heated, surrounded by lush pals and foliage. Fountains and waterfalls iinto the pool. Varying depths. A bridge led into the center where there were additional lounge chairs and Jacuzzi. There is ping-pong, shuffleboard, daily activities and a really great ropes and zip line course. There were poolside cabanas at no additional cost. As a guest at Lakeshore reserve, we had access to the pool at the Ritz-Carlton and JW Marriott Hotel. We visited each and it was wonderful. The concierge was very helpful and was able to get our tickets at a discounted rate. There is a small restaurant called blossoms which has outdoor dining and covered dining.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.text: This was a business trip, but we will return with the kids - great place to relax after a full day at the parks.
reviews.title: family vacation

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and we were very pleased!
reviews.title: Nice Facility, Indifferent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We exchanged for the Thanksgiving Week. The property is beautiful and the rooms big and very nicely decorated. Check-in was a breeze and the staff very friendly. Near the main attractions and outlet malls. We will definitely go back and I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property, Okay Room

reviews.text: We stayed over the Easter holiday weekend. We are owners of both Marriott vacation club and Disney vacation club. During this vacation we stayed at Lakeshore Reserve and Disney's Beach Club. Based on the room alone, this resort has it all over the Beach Club. We stayed in a two bedroom unit at both places. This resort has a beautiful pool that was heated to the perfect temperature. The room itself is fresh and clean with quality furnishings with ample space. The veranda's were decked out with comfy outdoor furniture. The perfect spot to escape with a good book. The showers are spacious with two separate shower heads. The pace at this resort takes you down a notch before you unpack. Staff was very friendly and seemed glad to be working here. It is a small, intimate resort that is in the backyard of the Marriott Vacation Club's headquarters. You will be hard-pressed to find a finer representation of what the Marriott Vacation Club represents.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort

reviews.text: Marriott's are well known for luxury and great customer service and the Lakeshore Reserve in Orlando has to be one of the finest. Great location to airport, theme parks, I-4 and conference center. Next to Ritz Carlton where a spa treatment is a short walk or courtesy golf cart ride away, or maybe hit some links on thier course. Lush palms surround the Lakeshore's property and pool. BBQ areas are set up to grill outdoors and a walking trail connecting to JW Marriott and Ritz is a good 2 miles. Rooms are set up comfortably with either a whole suite or lockoff and the decor is rich in earth tones with a kitchen anyone would not mind cooking in.
reviews.title: My favorite Marriott

reviews.text: Ive stayed here many times as I travel to Florida often and is my first choice hotel/resort. Being a multiple timeshare owner, Ive switched weeks to stay here and enjoy being pampered.
reviews.title: Excellent. Very nice

reviews.text: Probably one of the few places where the "professional photos" are pretty close to the real thing. Stayed at a "studio" (smallest room type), an outsized normal room with a kitchenette (small sink, microwave, mini fridge, coffee machine, no stove". Nice size balcony. Property is very well maintained / manicured. Lazy pool is awesome -- warm temp, deep enough for adults, swallow enough for young kids. Property has small room count which is nice = never feels crowded and has a nice tranquil feel about it (we were there during busy/peak Easter).
reviews.title: Best Marriott suites!

reviews.text: Dining options are very limited, really just a pool side place for lunch and dinner. But makes sense given rooms have kitchens. Nearby fast food options within 3-mile radius so no problem. Also JW and Ritz on the same property grounds -- but a little too far to be walkable.
reviews.title: My first Vacation Club stay was awesome!

reviews.text: This was our first time staying here and we had a great experience. We came to Florida to visit Disneyworld for a week and chose Lakeshore Reserve as our stay. So glad we did! Our 2 bedroom villa had plenty of room and was very comfortable. The pool area was perfect for the kids. The double water slides and lazy river were a hit with all of us. I loved that we could use the pools at both of the neighboring hotels (J.W. Marriott and Ritz). They provide shuttle rides to each. I do wish they would provide at least a one time cleaning in the middle of the week when booking a full week but they don't. You'll have to pay extra for that. Overall, I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

reviews.text: Can't say enough!!! We loved this hotel! Disagree w reviewer below saying its more for adults...my 6 & 7 year old had a blast! We did all of Disney & enjoyed most activities at the hotel. We sang our hearts out at karaoke night, kids made tie dye shirts, we loved the pool and the water slides were a blast for the kids AND us adults. Tip - kids must be 42" to do water slides! Thank goodness my son just made it or it would have been a huge bummer. We stayed on the 4th floor in Messina building. Our room was cleaned everyday and they even remembered to empty coffee grounds/clean coffee pot and run the dishwasher for us everyday. Our 1 bedrm was perfect for family of 4. Rooms had washer & dryer with basic supplies (laund det, dish soap, etc.) We cannot wait to go back! The best!
reviews.title: The best of everything!

reviews.text: This is a newest Marriott Vacation Resort in Orlando. The rooms are fabulous and diverse, ranging from a simple room with a kitchenette to a 3 bedroom townhouse. It is elegantly appointed and you can walk about 10 minutes over to the JW Marriott to grab their exquisite breakfast buffet and use their facilities as well.
reviews.title: Good now, should be great later.

reviews.text: Now to the cons:
reviews.title: Wonderful!!

reviews.text: 1) it is small property in this stage of development, and at full occupancy quite often, so there's not much chance to extend checkout time, extend your stay, or check in early. In fact, your room will probably not be ready on time, from my experience.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.text: Gorgeous hotel with a great lazy river. Front desk called us and maid was knocking at the door prior to the 10am checkout time which I found a bit harsh. We loved the lazy river at both properties. Would love to stay there again.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel with great lazy river. Hotel pushes you out of your room prior to 10am.

reviews.text: We stayed in a 3 bedroom villa which was plenty of room for the 9 of us traveling. The villa was clean, modern and had the softest carpet. We especially enjoyed the private patio with large table/umbrella and 2 outdoor loungers. Master bedroom was on the main level and had walk in shower. Both bedrooms upstairs had 2 double beds and individual bathroom. The dinner table was big enough for 10 and was great for family meals. It was very quiet during our stay in mid April. Quiet!!!! The pool was never crowded and seating was not a issue. There was a small playground and obstacle course onsite...and a very short walk to the basketball courts shared with the JW Marriott. The landscape along the patio areas was full of flowers and there was a boardwalk along the edge of the lake. The resort was relatively small with an empty lot right next to our building (not a problem though). There were a wide range of activities - not many but just enough and appealed to various ages. The resort was serene (of course may be different during summer months) and would appeal to couples and families like ours with grandparents traveling.
reviews.title: Peaceful and great for Multi-generational families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Poolside restaurant, Blossoms with all American food ( wings,fries,sandwiches, salads). Pizza available at the Marketplace. Food was tasty. My child became ill during our stay and the staff was extremely helpful and courteous. A front desk team member stopped by with a card and balloons and definitely made our stay more personable..
reviews.title: Would stay again in a heartbeat

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay and definitely recommend to others.
reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect!

reviews.text: We were only able to stay one night but wished we could have stayed longer. Check-in went smoothly and the front desk person was very helpful and friendly. The layout of the room was great and the king bed was so comfy. The most favorite part of our stay was the lazy river pool, which was absolutely heavenly. We would have liked check-out to be a little later than 10:00. We had breakfast at the sister J W Marriott, and we enjoyed the buffet there. Overall a wonderful stay!
reviews.title: Fanstastic

reviews.text: If you decide to stay here just beware that if you book a room on a AAA or a government rate there is a good possibility that they will try and deceive you and give you a smaller villa than their standard large 800 sq foot 1 BR villa. This has happened twice to me and now I am fed up. This is no way to spend a vacation. I will give my business to other hotels who do not play the "bait and switch" game. Management did not even care and does not want to keep my business. We also had some housekeeping issues this time around and I was not happy.
reviews.title: Beware when booking

reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at the Lakeshore reserve. The two bedroom appartment was perfect for our family. very quiet and peaceful, ideally located. The only negative was the caterpillar infested balcony due to the low hanging trees. If i went again, I would ask for a top floor appartment. otherwise very good place to stay.
reviews.title: Lovely stay at Lakeshore

reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights with the kids (5 and 2 years old) and this hotel is perfect as it is not far from the parks and you have a nice pool and playground for the kids.
reviews.title: Ideal with kids

reviews.text: The rooms were very good, new, the kitchen has everything we needed and everything working.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed
Best place to stay in Orlando!
reviews.text: Highly recommended.

Heated pool and hot tub was the bomb! Great full service market place store on the property, very convenient! The service at the bar is outstanding! 2 bedroom condo is well equipped but a bit small for 5 female shoppers
reviews.title: Fab resort Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at Lakeshore Reserve and were amazed at the immaculate grounds of the complex, which includes the JW Marriott and Ritz. The properties are connected so it is great for walking, trading pools or restaurants. The entire week we slumbered around the lazy river and pool that was very close to our room. The only negative would be for families going to the parks, because the complex in quite removed from the I-4 corridor. Our plans that week May 19-26 2012, were to be as lazy as possible, and we did achieve this with minor interuptions of walking the area.
reviews.title: Magnificent Property

reviews.text: PROS
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.text: Great walking area between the three complexes
reviews.title: Timeshare Wars - Episode 1: Marriott vs. Disney

reviews.text: A variety of restaurant opportunites
reviews.title: Another Great Marriott Property

reviews.text: This is our 3rd visit to Lakeshore Reserve. The 3 bedroom unit is beautiful and the grounds are lovely. However, there are certain standards that have changed. There used to be full service at the pool, with several waiters attending to you poolside. This trip there was one gentlemen, who was working very hard, but we had to go to the bar to order, and at times the service was slow. This high level resort should have more staff poolside to make guests feel they are experiencing the five star service that is expected at a JW/Ritz complex. Another huge tip would be to create a path through the green area to the JW. There is a very circuitous route that takes extra time that could be easily fixed.
reviews.title: Service has changed

reviews.text: Best things...pool is quiet even on a busy Christmas week...never feel crowded, like at the JW.
reviews.title: The Best!

reviews.text: Front desk is very polite and helpful.
reviews.title: Love lake shore!!!

reviews.text: There is a delivery service Gardengrocer.com that will deliver your groceries/beer/wine
reviews.title: Lots of Luxury
Beautiful resort, shame about the staff!
reviews.text: We enjoyed our time staying on property..Primo's restaurant at the JW is wonderful and the breakfast at Citron is great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a 2 bedroom villa on this trip. What a beautiful and spacious room. The pool is huge and is never crowded. The property is gorgeous. It is within walking distance to the JW Marriott and The Ritz Carlton. Housekeeping staff was great. They have a great gym. Only one restaurant on property. The JW and the Ritz offer many great dining experiences. I would highly recommend lunch at the spa at the Ritz. The Vitale Cafe has the best seafood (shrimp, ahi tuna and blue crab) Go treat yourself!
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: We rented a lovely one bedroom villa and couldn't have been more pleased. The villa is beautiful with a spacious kitchen with granite counter tops. It was supplied with every necessary item you would need to cook a beautiful meal which is what we did. We celebrated New years here and it was a great place to accommodate our family that came in for the day. The pool is beautiful and was so warm. Even though the temperature was 65 degrees outside, we all got in the 84 degree pool and loved it. There are two hot tubs to enjoy. This is a very lush and beautiful setting. A real treat. Shopping is convenient for groceries and there are great restaurants everywhere. My son lives in Orlando so we went to restaurants outside of the resort that he recommended. We were surprised they didn't have pool side waiters for our cocktail orders. For a resort of this caliber we expected that.
reviews.title: Oasis in the middle of the rat race.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sometimes we like to stay on Disney property, or at least closer to Disney World. For this trip, we were attending an event at the Convention Center, and Lakeshore Reserve is about 3.5 miles away. This proved to be an easy drive, We enjoyed "at home" days at the resort as well, hanging around at the pool. We walked over to the JW Marriott and the Ritz, and decided we liked Lakeshore's pool just as well.
reviews.title: Nice base for a Convention Center trip

reviews.text: Overall, the unit was clean, well furnished, and constructed with high end finishes. My only complaint is that by timeshare standards, the kitchen was not well stocked. No egg beater, baking tins, mixing bowls etc. The items provided were adequate to make rudimentary meals, but I was surprised that the Marriott fell short of most other "lesser" resorts we have stayed at. Also, unless you happen to carry a lighter around with you, you need to call maintenance to come light the grill if you wish to cook outside. This is inconvenient.
reviews.title: A fine respite

reviews.text: If I were planning a trip to spend most days at Disney, I would stay at a resort closer to Disney World. For a trip including Seaworld, Universal, Outlet Malls, the convention center, and other activities, Lakeshore is a great choice.
reviews.title: Quiet & Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed the other day at Marriott’s Lakeshore Reserve resort. It is a beautiful newer hotel on a property called the Grande Lakes- the same location where the JW Marriott and Ritz are also housed. It is only a few minutes drive to pretty much most of Orlando, including the tourist areas (I-drive).
reviews.title: Pretty Awesome! (for the most part...)

reviews.text: The lobby at this property is huge and very well decorated. It makes you feel very comfortable. Jada helped us check in. She couldn’t have been more helpful or friendly. She described all of what there is to do on the property, where everything is at and even gave us a list of activities happening at the resort. I know some people mentioned that you cannot check in until after 4pm but we got there around 3-3:30 so I suppose it just depends on which room you get.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort near the attractions

reviews.text: I really would like to rate this property better. I stayed here based on all of the TripAdvisor reviews but it fell short of my expectations for a Marriott property (I have stayed at many Marriott’s over the years). There were a lot of great, great features but our rocky start to the stay kind of has me confused about I feel about the stay.
reviews.title: great facility with not so great staff

reviews.text: Our room was in the Messina building. We had what they call a “luxury villa.” It had to be one of the most beautiful rooms I have ever stayed in. It was so thoughtfully and tastefully decorated. I felt like I was in a room that cost way more than I actually paid. Our room had a king bed, mini kitchen and pullout queen sofa. (See pictures). However, our room was on the first floor with a wonderful view of the parking lot. I made our reservations back in August. I requested a higher floor on multiple occasions. I don’t see why this request shouldn’t have been fulfilled with this much notice. We had a room in the front of the building right next to the front door and elevator. To top it off, our little corner area where our room was at was the only area with tile floors outside the room, instead of carpeting. Let’s just say we heard even the slightest noise. When we walked into the building, we were greeted by about 10 loud construction workers leaving. Not a big deal since they were leaving. Not so. Sitting in our living room, all we could hear was tile being chiseled in the room upstairs- something that should have been done earlier in the day before guests arrived. Also one of the previous guests thought it would be funny to go around and put the parental lock on all of the TVs in the suite. The front desk sent up an engineer who tried his hardest but could not ultimately figure it out. So we only got basic channels. My concern is I called the front desk and was told there was nowhere else they could move us, nothing they could do- even with all the noise and non-working amenities in our bottom floor room we asked not to get. The bathroom was very well decorated as well. Granite countertops and the works. I know this resort is new and all but they need to get some new cleaning supplies or something because the fixtures and grout is showing a lot of wear and discoloring for being so new.
reviews.title: Charming Villas around a Pool

reviews.text: We decided to forget about all that and just go and hang out by the pool. Thank goodness for this pool and its lazy river. It is somewhere where you can go and relax and forget everything else. Though the lazy river is not as big as the one at the JW Marriott next door, it is still just perfect. The water is kept warm throughout the day and was great to visit both during the day and at night. The spa was pretty nice too. My favorite part was getting a drink from the bar during happy hour and just floating away down the lazy river. I would definitely recommend heading over to Walgreens or Wal-Mart and buying an inflatable tube there as they are kind of pricey at the market place.
reviews.title: Perfect for what we were looking for! Would definitely stay again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Exchanged our of our Marriott timeshare units for a week here in a 2 bedroom unit for a week, May 5-12, 2013. Received a unit at the end of the Messina Building, directly facing the golf course and small lake area. Absolute perfect location.
reviews.title: Wow!
Dont get the studio
reviews.text: Unit had 2 bedrooms, one with a King bed, the other with 2 queens, and both had full bathrooms. Large living room/dining room, and kitchen had a laundry room next to it.
Liked watching the golfers from our unit and one day saw a large alligator swimming around the small lake. He's probably still out there somewhere!
reviews.title: Loved it,

reviews.text: This resort is unlike other Marriott timeshare units in that it has a lazy river which was wonderful to use. You can use the pool facilities at the JW Marriott and Ritz Carlton next door also, put we mainly used the Lakeshore Resort due to proximity to our room and loved the lazy river. All ages were using the lazy river, but it was not crowded.
reviews.title: Beautiful Stay

reviews.text: Did tie-dying one day for activities. Ate at the pool bar next to the lazy river with typical burgers and daily drink specials a couple of days. Marriott Lakeshore Reserve has a large marketplace. We bought inner tubes in the marketplace which they blew up for us, but found noodles worked better in the lazy river.
reviews.title: Relaxing...Very Pleasant
